headline: TSMC Q4 profit poised to soar 27% as AI demand drives growth
summary: TSMC, the world's largest manufacturer of advanced artificial intelligence chips, is expected to post a 27% jump in fourth-quarter net profit to a record due to ​the seemingly insatiable demand for AI infrastructure.  Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co, the world's top contract chipmaker and ‌a key supplier to Nvidia and Apple, is forecast to report a net profit of T$475.2 billion ($15.02 billion) for the three months through ‌December 31, according to an LSEG SmartEstimate compiled from 19 analysts.  TSMC, Asia's most valuable listed company with a market capitalisation of around $1.38 trillion - more than twice that of South Korean rival Samsung Electronics - is due to report on Thursday and will provide first-quarter and full-year guidance ⁠in an earnings call scheduled for ‌0600 GMT.

content.title: TSMC Q4 profit poised to soar 27% as AI demand drives growth
content.summary: TSMC, the world's largest manufacturer of advanced artificial intelligence chips, is expected to post a 27% jump in fourth-quarter net profit to a record due to ​the seemingly insatiable demand for AI infrastructure.  Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co, the world's top contract chipmaker and ‌a key supplier to Nvidia and Apple, is forecast to report a net profit of T$475.2 billion ($15.02 billion) for the three months through ‌December 31, according to an LSEG SmartEstimate compiled from 19 analysts.  TSMC, Asia's most valuable listed company with a market capitalisation of around $1.38 trillion - more than twice that of South Korean rival Samsung Electronics - is due to report on Thursday and will provide first-quarter and full-year guidance ⁠in an earnings call scheduled for ‌0600 GMT.

headline: Apple leads global smartphone market in 2025, says Counterpoint
summary:
STORY: Global smartphone shipments rose 2% year-on-year in 2025.

That's according to leading analyst Counterpoint Research Monday (January 12).

It said sales were lifted by stronger demand and economic strength in emerging markets.

Apple led the market with a 20% share.

Counterpoint said the U.S. tech giant saw solid demand in emerging and mid-sized markets.

And it enjoyed strong sales of the iPhone 17 series.

Galaxy maker Samsung came second with a 19% share on modest shipment growth.

While China's Xiaomi was third on a 13% share and supported by steady demand in emerging markets.

Counterpoint said the global smartphone market is expected to soften this year due to chip shortages and rising component costs.

That as chipmakers focus on AI data centers over handsets.

content.title: Apple leads global smartphone market in 2025, says Counterpoint
content.summary:
STORY: Global smartphone shipments rose 2% year-on-year in 2025.

That's according to leading analyst Counterpoint Research Monday (January 12).

It said sales were lifted by stronger demand and economic strength in emerging markets.

Apple led the market with a 20% share.

Counterpoint said the U.S. tech giant saw solid demand in emerging and mid-sized markets.

And it enjoyed strong sales of the iPhone 17 series.

Galaxy maker Samsung came second with a 19% share on modest shipment growth.

While China's Xiaomi was third on a 13% share and supported by steady demand in emerging markets.

Counterpoint said the global smartphone market is expected to soften this year due to chip shortages and rising component costs.

That as chipmakers focus on AI data centers over handsets.

headline: Alphabet hits $4 trillion valuation as AI refocus lifts sentiment
summary: Alphabet hit a $4 trillion market valuation on Monday, as the Google parent's sharpened artificial intelligence focus allayed doubts about its strategy ​and thrust it back to the forefront of the high-stakes race.  The tech giant ‌on Wednesday surpassed Apple in market capitalization for the first time since 2019, becoming the second most ‌valuable company in the world.  The milestones mark a remarkable change in investor sentiment for Alphabet, with its stock surging about 65% in 2025, outperforming its peers on Wall Street's elite group of stocks, the so-called Magnificent Seven.

content.title: Alphabet hits $4 trillion valuation as AI refocus lifts sentiment
content.summary: Alphabet hit a $4 trillion market valuation on Monday, as the Google parent's sharpened artificial intelligence focus allayed doubts about its strategy ​and thrust it back to the forefront of the high-stakes race.  The tech giant ‌on Wednesday surpassed Apple in market capitalization for the first time since 2019, becoming the second most ‌valuable company in the world.  The milestones mark a remarkable change in investor sentiment for Alphabet, with its stock surging about 65% in 2025, outperforming its peers on Wall Street's elite group of stocks, the so-called Magnificent Seven.

headline: Alphabet Becomes Newest $4 Trillion Company, Joining Nvidia
summary: Google parent  Alphabet  value topped $4 trillion in intraday trade, making it the latest tech company to cross that threshold as investors reward the internet-search leader for its artificial-intelligence gains.  Shares in  Alphabet  rose 1.66% to a record $334.04 on Monday morning, putting its market capitalization at $4.03 trillion for a time.  Four technology companies have traded at market capitalizations of $4 trillion, and only  Nvidia  is still above that mark.

content.title: Alphabet Becomes Newest $4 Trillion Company, Joining Nvidia
content.summary: Google parent  Alphabet  value topped $4 trillion in intraday trade, making it the latest tech company to cross that threshold as investors reward the internet-search leader for its artificial-intelligence gains.  Shares in  Alphabet  rose 1.66% to a record $334.04 on Monday morning, putting its market capitalization at $4.03 trillion for a time.  Four technology companies have traded at market capitalizations of $4 trillion, and only  Nvidia  is still above that mark.

headline: Apple, Google strike Gemini deal for revamped Siri in major win for Alphabet
summary: Apple  will use Google's Gemini models for its revamped Siri coming later this year under a multi-year deal that ​deepens the tech giants' alliance in the artificial intelligence era ‌and bolsters Alphabet's position in the race against OpenAI.  The deal announced Monday marks a major ‌vote of confidence for Google.  Its technology already drives much of Samsung's "Galaxy AI," but the Siri deal unlocks a large market with Apple's installed base of more than two billion active devices.

content.title: Apple, Google strike Gemini deal for revamped Siri in major win for Alphabet
content.summary: Apple  will use Google's Gemini models for its revamped Siri coming later this year under a multi-year deal that ​deepens the tech giants' alliance in the artificial intelligence era ‌and bolsters Alphabet's position in the race against OpenAI.  The deal announced Monday marks a major ‌vote of confidence for Google.  Its technology already drives much of Samsung's "Galaxy AI," but the Siri deal unlocks a large market with Apple's installed base of more than two billion active devices.

headline: Apple, Google Confirm Multiyear Deal for AI Technology, Siri
summary: “After careful evaluation, Apple determined that Google’s Al technology provides the most capable foundation for Apple Foundation Models and is excited about the innovative new experiences it will unlock for Apple users,” the two companies said Monday in a joint statement.  Bloomberg reported late last year that the two companies were finalizing such a deal, with Apple planning to pay about $1 billion a year.

content.title: Apple, Google Confirm Multiyear Deal for AI Technology, Siri
content.summary: “After careful evaluation, Apple determined that Google’s Al technology provides the most capable foundation for Apple Foundation Models and is excited about the innovative new experiences it will unlock for Apple users,” the two companies said Monday in a joint statement.  Bloomberg reported late last year that the two companies were finalizing such a deal, with Apple planning to pay about $1 billion a year.
